treatment.description: Leaves elliptic, apex broadly acute to rounded-acute, mucronate or apiculate, occasionally obtuse, margins recurved at mid leaf, bordered throughout or in lower 2/3 with 2(–3) rows of narrower, short- to long-rectangular, thicker-walled, somewhat less papillose cells that are 1–2-stratose; costa percurrent or short-excurrent, lacking an adaxial pad of cells, distally narrow, 3–4 cells across the convex adaxial surface; distal laminal cells hexagonal to rectangular, 16–21 µm wide, 1–2:1, strongly 2-fid papillose. Sexual condition autoicous. Sporophytes exerted. Seta 0.9–1.5 cm. Capsule stegocarpic, not systylius, cylindric, horizontal or pendent, nearly straight, urn 1.8–2.5 mm; peristome 300–500 µm, teeth 16, weakly twisted to twisted 1 turn, divided nearly to the base into 2–3 branches and variously perforate, basal membrane low, ca. 50 µm; operculum 0.5–1.2 mm. Spores 18–23(–35) µm, spheric, densely papillose.
treatment.habitat: Soil, rock crevices, especially calcareous substrates, tundra, essentially subalpine;
